name: Logarithm Properties
latex: \log(ab) = \log a + \log b, \quad \log(\frac{a}{b}) = \log a - \log b, \quad \log(a^n) = n\log a
explanation: Logarithms have three fundamental properties that mirror the properties of exponents. The product rule: log of a product equals sum of logs. The quotient rule: log of a quotient equals difference of logs. The power rule: log of a power equals exponent times log. These properties are essential for solving logarithmic equations and simplifying expressions.

steps: Using product rule: log(2) + log(3) = log(2 × 3)
Using quotient rule: log(8) - log(2) = log(8/2)

proof: Product rule: log(ab) = log(a) + log(b). Proof: Let x = log(a), y = log(b), so a = 10^x, b = 10^y. Then ab = 10^x × 10^y = 10^(x+y). Taking log: log(ab) = x + y = log(a) + log(b). Quotient rule: log(a/b) = log(a) - log(b). Power rule: log(a^n) = n log(a). Both follow from product rule.
